intro: Hieracium polyanchodes, commonly known as the New Zealand buttercup, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as riverbanks and grasslands. It features yellow petals surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, and its leaves are usually heart-shaped with a rough texture. Hieracium polyanchodes is often found in coastal and subalpine regions, where it thrives in temperate climates.
